competitors.name: Compaq
competitors.notes: PC market leader in 2000, briefly overtook Dell; acquired Digital Equipment Corporation (1998) and Tandem Computers (1997)

competitors.name: Dell
competitors.notes: Became number-one PC supplier in 1999, competitive in hardware and direct sales model

competitors.name: Hewlett-Packard
competitors.notes: Major competitor in hardware, servers, storage devices, and enterprise systems

competitors.name: Sun Microsystems
competitors.notes: Key competitor in enterprise servers and Unix systems

competitors.name: Oracle
competitors.notes: Competitor in enterprise software and database systems

competitors.name: Microsoft
competitors.notes: Competitor in software and emerging enterprise solutions

context: In 2000, IBM competed across personal computers, enterprise servers, and IT services. The PC market was highly competitive with Compaq briefly regaining the top position from Dell. IBM was transitioning focus from hardware to services.
